bill.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 8070) to authorize appropriations for fiscal year 2025 for military activities of the Department of Defense, for military construction, and for defense activities of the Department of Energy, to prescribe military personnel strengths for such fiscal year; relating to the consideration of House Report 118-527 and an accompanying resolution; and for other purposes.
bill.description: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 8070) to authorize appropriations for fiscal year 2025 for military activities of the Department of Defense, for military construction, and for defense activities of the Department of Energy, to prescribe military personnel strengths for such fiscal year; relating to the consideration of House Report 118-527 and an accompanying resolution; and for other purposes.

history.action: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 118-551, by Mr. Scott, Austin.

The resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 8070 under a structured rule and the resolution accompanying House Report 118-527 under a closed rule. The resolution provides for one hour of general debate on each measure and one motion to recommit on H.R. 8070.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 82.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H3730-3736)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 1287.

POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - At the conclusion of debate on H. Res. 1287, the Chair put the question on ordering the previous question and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Scanlon demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Considered as unfinished business. (consideration: CR H3737-3738)
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 210 - 204 (Roll no. 250).
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 208 - 207 (Roll no. 251). (text: CR H3730-3731)
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

votes.desc: On Ordering the Previous Question RC# 250
On Agreeing to the Resolution RC# 251
